conbody.p: Intelligent Environments provides REST and WebSocket services to access data. Responses are in JSON format.

As defined by the query parameters, the Intelligent Environments APIs use "filter" functions to access raw data using HTTPS, and"live" functions to request a WebSocket for receiving near real-time data from any active sensor.
IMPORTANT: Do not create your own URIs. Instead, use the links in this document to navigate between resources.
conbody.example:
Using the GET LIST OF ASSETS, GET LIST OF LOCATIONS, or GET EVENTS APIs. 
Example
Starting with Get List of Assets:https://{{metadataurl}}/v2/assets/search?bbox=<long,lat>
Starting with Get List of Locations
                     https://{{metadataurl}}/v2/locations/search?bbox=<long,lat>
Options for using Get Events (PULL)
By AssetUidhttps://{{eventurl}}/v2/assets/<assetUid>/events?eventTypes=<event-type>&startTime=<EPOCH_Timestamp>&endTime=<EPOCH_Timestamp> 
By Locationshttps://{{eventurl}}/v2/locations/events?bbox=""&radius=""&eventtype=<String>&locationtype=<String>&starttime=<EPOCH_Timestamp>&endtime=<EPOCH_Timestamp>
By LocationUidhttps://{{eventurl}}/v2/locations/{locationUid}/events?eventType=<String>&starttime=<EPOCH_Timestamp>&endtime=<EPOCH_Timestamp>
                
Options for using Push Events (STREAM)
Websocket URL: wss://<production url>/events 
By AssetUID{“assetUid":"<assetUID>","eventTypes":["<eventType1>, <eventType2>”]}

By Location{"bbox":"<long,lat>","eventTypes":[“<eventType1>,<eventType2>”]}>
By LocationUid{“locationUid":"<location-UID>","eventTypes":[" <eventType1>,< eventType2>"]}
To get the event streaming, you need to retrieve the URI in the PULL Events section above.
